intro: Albizia cambodiana, commonly known as Cambodian silk tree, is a deciduous leguminous tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant has a deep root system that helps in soil stabilization and nitrogen fixation. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of soil types. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in warm climates.
